review_text: This is a prime area for surfers. The beach was rather littered with debris and rubbish during our visit. This is a black sand beach and very popular with surfers and surfing contests. There is a choice of accommodation in all budgets within a stroll of the beach. Great for a few days of relaxing and getting away from the crowds and good choice for surfers

Took my 16 year old out here early the other morning for the famous wave and we were lucky to score it on a good day. Punchy 3 foot tube ride and about 15 others out there ripping it. Definite must for the surfers out there. Black sand beach glittered in the sun.

review_title: QUIET, CALM SERENE - in the shoulder season
review_text: Keramas Beach was recommended by friends... during the shoulder season, it was a laid-back, serene, clean beach.  There is an ‘international cuisine’ restaurant, and villas right on the beach-front. In the late afternoon, there were a few folks fishing, and children playing on the beach. Very relaxing !

Vast black sand beach 20mins NE of Sanur popular for surfing although there were only one or two boards out when I was there. Not sure about swimming as there were no signs up or flags on safe parts of the beach to swim. I would say not for children or non confident swimmers. You can see more of the coast and across to Nusa Penida.
There is not much going on, minimal facilities.. accommodation, places to eat etc.

One wave from the best surfeurs in the world! Thank you Keramas & Corona Bali Protected! Thank you Kanoa Igarashi for the dreamy show! Thank you Kelly Slater & Stephanie Gilmore for the surf lesson just watching you!

I will admit that I had given up on Bali's beaches (excluding the smaller islands) but on my last day I was able to visit Keramas and very happy I did. The black sand was beautiful that day, and the strong sun helped it gleam and shine against the blue water, making it a very dramatic sight. A handful of little cafes (excellently priced) and nice resorts make it an easy beach to go to for any budget. Would love to stay on the beach next time.

watch so many young man surf in this beach is make me fell want to learn how to surf , with good wafe

when I was enjoy my self watch the waves rooling down to the beach make me realize why the like to surf in this beach, big waves & not too crowd thats why they comr here to surf.

.
Less tourist, good spot for surf. I heart this places has nice wave for people doing surf, specially at night house they have big light.
amazing to see jet black natural volcanic beach. great surf beach but also great to explore with the many natural objects that are washed up from the ocean floor.

Do you like white sandy beaches? Have you visit a black sand beach?
Black sand shimmers in a way white can't. It's beautiful and magical.

But this is not a beach to lay and relax. It's very empty and have just a few places to eat and no chairs. Also black sand does stick everywhere. :-)

But if you want a bit alone time on a beach, this is perfect.
great for surfing, black sand beaches! really awesome place if youre a surfer... its world famous! we dont surf but enjoyed the area around and took cars to get to other restaurants nearby!
Lovely beach with high waves, sand was too dark and the view was spectacular. It isnt safe to swim due to the high waves though.

You need to see the black sparkly sand on this beach to believe how amazing it is. The beach isnt the best for swimming, but great for surfing. Good for wetting your legs or a quick dip at high tide. A beautiful outlook and place to watch the surfers from the Komune Resort.

review_title: Wild water, good for surfers, not for swinmming
review_text: We lived in the Diamond Villas at Keramas Beach. Unfortunately we are not surfer and weren't aware that the beach is not good for swimming so we couldn't use it. We walked some tours and dined at Timor Kitchen (very recommendable) and the Swan Restaurant (nice place). The beach is ok clean and if you like big waves it is nice to sit and look over the wild ocean.
This is a black sand beach with great sunset views and good surf. The beach is not so clean but still nice for a relaxing walk.

review_title: Amazing Beach with black sparkling sand and incredible sunset!
review_text: An Amazing Beach with black sparkling sand that shines like glitter and incredible sunsets every day! Great surf spot or place to relax!
This beach is could be so beautiful, but there is so much litter everywhere it's a real shame. It's worth the visit regardless.
good for surfing, otherwise not very pretty beach, dark sand. But you can enjoy at the resort infant of the beach

For visitors such as myself coming from Australia, I am used to white sandy beaches. Keramas does not have that. It has black sand, which is due to the volcanoes of Bali and the black sand shimmers in the sunlight.

The beach itself would be picture perfect if were were not for rubbish left strewn around, which certainly lessens its beauty. However, the rubbish is less than is regularly sighted on Kuta Beach.

Keramas Beach is only 45 minutes drive from Kuta and is worth the visit for a walk along the black sand or to catch to some good sized waves.

review_title: Walking in the beach with black sands
review_text: This beach with black sands collection. You can play surfing here of playing with sands. Around this beach, many restaurant and hotel.
This is a great beach for surf. Have good waves but the water is not so clean and have a lot of trash. Just surf not swim....

review_title: Take a long walk on this Keramas black sand!
review_text:
You will not be able to swim on this beach, but you will definitely love a long beach walk on this black sand while enjoying the warm water of Indian Ocean.
There is a wooden bar at the entrance from the road, where you can enjoy your Coconut with only 15 000,00 idr while listening to the ocean.
The place is not crowded at all, so if you need a momentous of quietness this is a place for you!

Nice Place ,
Swim with dolphin
For sunset View
Very nice Place
Nice music with bar side of beach
Beautiful Wave
pretty good distance from us. but it paid off with a very beautiful waves for surfing, you better go with the local guide drivers gede +62 878-6136-8555

review_title: Great for surfers, otherwise very dirty
review_text: The beach itself is lovely - black volcano sand that sparkles on the sand, great waves and few nice spots to have a drink. Apart from that, unless you're staying at Komuna Resort & Beach Club (which has a small pool with some sunbeds around), you wouldn't want to put your towel on the beach itself. It's literally covered in garbage..
Wonderful spot. In a shiny day the black volcanic sand looks like filled with diamond powder. It shines. Huge waves and lotta surfers.
i loved this beach because there was almost no one! and more important my boyfriend had a really good surf!

review_title: Keramas beach is that exotic beauty with dark kohl eyes and long shimmery jet black hair
review_text:
If u are seeking a slightly different experience from white sandy beaches, mojitos and beach club pounding loud house music, u may want to explore the keramas black beach
I was looking for something different from a the perfectly manicured gardens and palm trees swaying and keramas beach situated on the south eastern side of Bali is a delightful gem.

There's something introspective and mystical about the black beach that can only be experienced if u do a lone beach walk, listening to the symphony of the Indian Ocean and let your imagination reach the far depths of the oceans trenches. You watch unrelenting waves satisfying the adrenalin of surfers, you observe the foamy sea water caressing every black stone that is a little piece of art from the stone carver call the Ocean. You can also spot locals flying kites, Balinese ladies offering canang to the spirits of the seas, and a smattering of vacationers on the beautiful beach front villas.

Komune beach club is a must visit, they have beautiful Nasi goreng and a good piña colada.
Do nothing except to breath, soak up the delicious saltiness of the ocean breeze, and catch the sunrise emerging from the distant mount Agung every morning
If the white sandy beach is that sexy perfectly tanned blond babe,Then the black beach of keramas must surely be that exotic beauty with dark kohl eyes and shimmery black hair

This is a great to surf when the wind is blowing onshore on Uluwatu. There is a beck break with lots of fun peaks and a reef brake in front of the Komune hotel. Great surf! just be sure to bring sandals ... the sand is really hot

review_title: Black sandy beach - amazing to see
review_text: What's all the secretness about where the black sandy beaches in Bali are?  There are kilometres and kilometres of them.  Many are very easy to reach and one is Keramas beach about half an hours taxi drive from Kuta.  My wife and I will come back and stay at the nearest resort/hotel next time.  This is a wonderful Balinese beach to visit and see black sand.  It has its own beauty.
great for surfing, black sand beaches! really awesome place if youre a surfer... its world famous! we dont surf but enjoyed the area around and took cars to get to other restaurants nearby!
Lovely beach with high waves, sand was too dark and the view was spectacular. It isnt safe to swim due to the high waves though.
